page.title: 19THE COUNTRYMAN BUS
page.content: The Countryman mini-bus was introduced in January 1981 to restore local bus services to an acceptable level. Management and operation of the scheme is performed by an Operating Group comprising of the Local County Councillor, representatives from local parish councils and officers of the County Council, supported by voluntary drivers. Weekly services are provided to Newark and Southwell on Wednesday and Saturday respectively, from the villages of Maplebeck, Kirklington, Eakring, Winkburn and Hockerton. A school service also runs from Eakring to Kneesall on weekdays during term - time. The vehicle is available for private hire and is extensively used by local youth clubs, Womens Insts. and other organisations. Hire charges and fares do not cover operating costs so there is a Local Authority subsidy.
